With over a decade of operational excellence, we serve critical sectors including Oil &amp; Gas, Power, Mining, Cement, FMCG, and Heavy Industries

We are recruiting to fill the position below:

Job Position: Finance Officer

Job Location:&nbsp;Ikeja, GRA - Lagos

Key Responsibilities
International Finance (Major Responsibility Area):


	Manage international financial transactions, including foreign vendor payments and cross-border remittances.
	Monitor and analyze foreign exchange rates, currency fluctuations, and their impact on company finances.
	Ensure compliance with international finance regulations, foreign remittance rules, and global reporting standards.
	Liaise with international suppliers, banks, and financial partners on payments, settlement terms, and documentation.


Financial Management &amp; Reporting:


	Prepare timely and accurate financial reports and account statements.
	Support budgeting, forecasting, and financial planning activities.
	Maintain general ledger entries and ensure accurate posting of transactions.
	Conduct regular bank reconciliations and cash flow monitoring.


Accounts Payable &amp; Receivable:


	Process local and international invoices, payments, and expense claims.
	Track receivables and ensure timely collections.
	Maintain up-to-date vendor and customer accounts.


Compliance &amp; Audit:


	Ensure adherence to relevant financial laws, accounting standards, and regulatory requirements.
	Ensure timely remittance of statutory deductions (PAYE, WHT, VAT, Pension, etc.).
	Assist with internal and external audits, including preparation of audit schedules.


Financial Controls &amp; Systems:


	Support ERP and financial systems usage, ensuring accurate data entry and reporting.
	Recommend improvements to financial procedures for greater efficiency.
	Maintain strict confidentiality and uphold internal control standards.


Other Duties:


	Provide financial insights and analysis to support management decisions.
	Work closely with procurement teams on financial documentation.
	Perform other finance-related duties as assigned by the Finance Manager.


Qualifications and Requirements


	Bachelor&rsquo;s Degree in Accounting, Finance, or related field.
	Minimum of 3 years of relevant experience, preferably in the engineering, construction, or technical services industry.
	Must be a Chartered Accountant (ICAN or ACCA certified).
	Strong understanding of project accounting and cost control principles.
	Proficient in accounting software such as QuickBooks, Sage, or similar platforms.
	Excellent analytical, numerical, and problem-solving skills.
	Strong attention to detail, accuracy, and integrity.
	Effective communication and interpersonal skills.
	Ability to work independently and collaboratively within a team-driven environment

Finance Officer Job at Raybond Technical Limited




        
    

        
        Raybond Technical Limited is a fully indigenous Engineering, Procurement, Construction, Installation, and Commissioning (EPCIC) service provider, delivering integrated technical solutions across Nigeria and beyond. With over a decade of operational excellence, we serve critical sectors including Oil & Gas, Power, Mining, Cement, FMCG, and Heavy Industries

We are recruiting to fill the position below:

Job Position: Finance Officer

Job Location: Ikeja, GRA - Lagos

Key Responsibilities
International Finance (Major Responsibility Area):
     

        



     (adsbygoogle = window.adsbygoogle || []).push({});
    
    




	Manage international financial transactions, including foreign vendor payments and cross-border remittances.
	Monitor and analyze foreign exchange rates, currency fluctuations, and their impact on company finances.
	Ensure compliance with international finance regulations, foreign remittance rules, and global reporting standards.
	Liaise with international suppliers, banks, and financial partners on payments, settlement terms, and documentation.


Financial Management & Reporting:


	Prepare timely and accurate financial reports and account statements.
	Support budgeting, forecasting, and financial planning activities.
	Maintain general ledger entries and ensure accurate posting of transactions.
	Conduct regular bank reconciliations and cash flow monitoring.


Accounts Payable & Receivable:


	Process local and international invoices, payments, and expense claims.
	Track receivables and ensure timely collections.
	Maintain up-to-date vendor and customer accounts.


Compliance & Audit:


	Ensure adherence to relevant financial laws, accounting standards, and regulatory requirements.
	Ensure timely remittance of statutory deductions (PAYE, WHT, VAT, Pension, etc.).
	Assist with internal and external audits, including preparation of audit schedules.


Financial Controls & Systems:


	Support ERP and financial systems usage, ensuring accurate data entry and reporting.
	Recommend improvements to financial procedures for greater efficiency.
	Maintain strict confidentiality and uphold internal control standards.


Other Duties:


	Provide financial insights and analysis to support management decisions.
	Work closely with procurement teams on financial documentation.
	Perform other finance-related duties as assigned by the Finance Manager.


Qualifications and Requirements


	Bachelor’s Degree in Accounting, Finance, or related field.
	Minimum of 3 years of relevant experience, preferably in the engineering, construction, or technical services industry.
	Must be a Chartered Accountant (ICAN or ACCA certified).
	Strong understanding of project accounting and cost control principles.
	Proficient in accounting software such as QuickBooks, Sage, or similar platforms.
	Excellent analytical, numerical, and problem-solving skills.
	Strong attention to detail, accuracy, and integrity.
	Effective communication and interpersonal skills.
	Ability to work independently and collaboratively within a team-driven environment

We are recruiting to fill the position below:

Job Position: Admin / Inventory Officer

Job Location:&nbsp;Surulere, Lagos
Employment Type: Full-time
Department: Operations &amp; Administration
Reports To: CEO

Job&nbsp;Description


	The Admin / Inventory Officer ensures effective administrative coordination, accurate material tracking, and timely support for the production and packaging teams.
	This role upholds accountability, documentation integrity, and operational discipline across alldepartments &mdash; ensuring that resources, materials, and records are efficiently managed and aligned with Slurp&rsquo;s&nbsp;production and business goals.


Key Objectives


	Maintain accurate and real-time inventory records for fruits, packaging materials, and supplies.
	Provide administrative and documentation support to management and all operational teams.
	Ensure timely procurement, stock replenishment, and record-keeping.
	Support compliance and ensure smooth daily workflow between production, packaging, andmanagement.


Core Responsibilities
Inventory Management:


	Maintain a daily log of all fruit, packaging, and supply items.
	Record stock inflow, usage, and balance on both the Inventory Board and Digital Tracker.
	Conduct physical stock checks weekly and reconcile with production and packaging logs.
	Update reorder levels and alert management before shortages occur.
	Support the Head of Production in verifying received materials for quality and quantity.
	Track suppliers, pricing, and delivery schedules for fruits and packaging materials.


Procurement &amp; Supply Coordination:


	Prepare and submit requisitions for approval based on stock levels.
	Source and negotiate with suppliers for cost efficiency.
	Collect receipts and delivery notes for all purchases and submit to Finance for reconciliation.
	Maintain vendor database (contact info, terms, and payment timelines).
	Ensure on-time delivery of fruits and supplies to avoid production downtime.


Administrative Support:


	Maintain a filing system for daily reports, invoices, and certificates.
	Collate and submit staff attendance, timesheets, and operational reports weekly.
	Support HR-related administrative tasks such as onboarding documentation and certification tracking.
	Prepare and print internal forms (requisitions, delivery notes, checklists, etc.).
	Manage correspondence between departments and ensure timely communication flow.


Reporting &amp; Compliance:


	Submit daily inventory reports to the Managing Partner.
	Maintain updated health and safety documentation (food handler, fumigation, medical, etc.).
	Support SOP implementation across departments by ensuring all checklists are in use.
	Assist in preparing monthly operational summaries (stock, supply, wastage).
	File and archive all supplier and operational records for easy reference.

	Strong organizational and multitasking abilities.
	Excellent written and verbal communication.
	Proficiency in Microsoft Excel, Google Sheets, and digital reporting tools.
	Integrity, accountability, and attention to detail.
	Ability to coordinate across multiple departments under pressure.
	Familiarity with inventory and administrative workflows in FMCG or production environments.


Qualifications


	Minimum of OND / HND / B.Sc in Business Administration, Supply Chain, or related field.
	2&ndash;3 years of relevant experience in administrative or inventory management roles.
	Prior experience in food production or beverage industry is an added advantage.


Work Schedule:


	Days: Monday to Saturday
	Hours: 8:30 AM &ndash; 5:00 PM (with flexibility during events or stock audit days)


Reporting Line &amp; Collaboration:
Collaborates With:


	Head of Production
	Head of Packaging
	Customer Service Representative
	Finance Officer


Salary

Admin / Inventory Officer Job at Resource Intermediaries Limited




        
    

        
        Resource Intermediaries Limited (RIL) is a company registered in Nigeria to engage in outsourcing services. We focus on three key areas; Human Resource Management, People Placement and Learning & Development. We provide a broad menu of Human Resource Outsourcing Services for companies from an economical complete service.

We are recruiting to fill the position below:

Job Position: Admin / Inventory Officer

Job Location: Surulere, Lagos
Employment Type: Full-time
Department: Operations & Administration
Reports To: CEO

Job Description
     

        



     (adsbygoogle = window.adsbygoogle || []).push({});
    
    




	The Admin / Inventory Officer ensures effective administrative coordination, accurate material tracking, and timely support for the production and packaging teams.
	This role upholds accountability, documentation integrity, and operational discipline across alldepartments — ensuring that resources, materials, and records are efficiently managed and aligned with Slurp’s production and business goals.


Key Objectives


	Maintain accurate and real-time inventory records for fruits, packaging materials, and supplies.
	Provide administrative and documentation support to management and all operational teams.
	Ensure timely procurement, stock replenishment, and record-keeping.
	Support compliance and ensure smooth daily workflow between production, packaging, andmanagement.


Core Responsibilities
Inventory Management:


	Maintain a daily log of all fruit, packaging, and supply items.
	Record stock inflow, usage, and balance on both the Inventory Board and Digital Tracker.
	Conduct physical stock checks weekly and reconcile with production and packaging logs.
	Update reorder levels and alert management before shortages occur.
	Support the Head of Production in verifying received materials for quality and quantity.
	Track suppliers, pricing, and delivery schedules for fruits and packaging materials.


Procurement & Supply Coordination:


	Prepare and submit requisitions for approval based on stock levels.
	Source and negotiate with suppliers for cost efficiency.
	Collect receipts and delivery notes for all purchases and submit to Finance for reconciliation.
	Maintain vendor database (contact info, terms, and payment timelines).
	Ensure on-time delivery of fruits and supplies to avoid production downtime.


Administrative Support:


	Maintain a filing system for daily reports, invoices, and certificates.
	Collate and submit staff attendance, timesheets, and operational reports weekly.
	Support HR-related administrative tasks such as onboarding documentation and certification tracking.
	Prepare and print internal forms (requisitions, delivery notes, checklists, etc.).
	Manage correspondence between departments and ensure timely communication flow.


Reporting & Compliance:


	Submit daily inventory reports to the Managing Partner.
	Maintain updated health and safety documentation (food handler, fumigation, medical, etc.).
	Support SOP implementation across departments by ensuring all checklists are in use.
	Assist in preparing monthly operational summaries (stock, supply, wastage).
	File and archive all supplier and operational records for easy reference.


Required Skills & Attributes:


	Strong organizational and multitasking abilities.
	Excellent written and verbal communication.
	Proficiency in Microsoft Excel, Google Sheets, and digital reporting tools.
	Integrity, accountability, and attention to detail.
	Ability to coordinate across multiple departments under pressure.
	Familiarity with inventory and administrative workflows in FMCG or production environments.


Qualifications


	Minimum of OND / HND / B.Sc in Business Administration, Supply Chain, or related field.
	2–3 years of relevant experience in administrative or inventory management roles.
	Prior experience in food production or beverage industry is an added advantage.


Work Schedule:


	Days: Monday to Saturday
	Hours: 8:30 AM – 5:00 PM (with flexibility during events or stock audit days)


Reporting Line & Collaboration:
Collaborates With:


	Head of Production
	Head of Packaging
	Customer Service Representative
	Finance Officer


Salary
N150,000 / month.

  "description": "Amicon Consultant&nbsp;- Our client, PWAN Lighthouse Limited Company, a dynamic and fast-growing player in the Nigerian Real Estate sector, is recruiting to fill the position below:

Job Position: Customer Representative Service Officer / Front Desk Officer

Job Location:&nbsp;Sangotedo, Ajah - Lagos
Employment Type: Full-time

The Role


	This is a pivotal dual-function role based at our Sangotedo, Ajah office.
	The successful candidate will serve as the company&#39;s first point of contact, managing all front-office operations, while also applying their practical knowledge in accounting for financial administration and assisting with basic legal documentation and filing related to property transactions.


Key Responsibilities
Front Desk &amp; Client Relations:


	Manage the reception area, professionally greeting and directing clients and visitors.
	Handle all incoming calls, emails, and correspondence efficiently.
	Maintain an organized, professional, and presentable office environment.
	Schedule and manage appointments, meetings, and company calendars.


Accounting Support:


	Process invoices, receipts, and payments, ensuring accuracy and proper documentation.
	Assist in basic bookkeeping, data entry, and maintenance of financial records.
	Reconcile petty cash and simple bank accounts.
	Support the accounting department with documentation and filing.


Legal/Administrative Support (Real Estate Focus):


	Assist in the preparation, documentation, and filing of legal paperwork related to property sales and acquisitions (e.g., offer letters, client agreements, initial documentation review).
	Maintain organized physical and electronic files for client contracts and legal documents, ensuring confidentiality.
	Facilitate the submission of documents to the legal department or external counsel.


What We Are Looking For
Educational Qualifications:


	A minimum of B.Sc., HND, B.Hons., or equivalent qualification in Administration, Mass Communication, Secretarial/Clerical fields, or any other related field.


Experience:


	3 to 5 years of working experience in a Customer Care, Front Desk, or Client Relations role, preferably within the Real Estate, Legal, or Financial services industries.


Skills &amp; Requirements:


	Proven, practical experience in basic Accounting or Bookkeeping is mandatory.
	Demonstrable experience or strong foundational knowledge in Legal Administration, Documentation, or Paralegal support, particularly concerning contracts or property agreements, is a significant advantage.
	Excellent verbal and written communication skills.
	Proficiency in Microsoft Office Suite (Word, Excel, Outlook).
	Exceptional organizational skills and high attention to detail, especially when handling confidential documents.
	Professional demeanor, integrity, and discretion.


Salary
N100,000 - N150,000 / month.

Customer Representative Service Officer / Front Desk Officer Job at Amicon Consultant




        
    

        
        Amicon Consultant - Our client, PWAN Lighthouse Limited Company, a dynamic and fast-growing player in the Nigerian Real Estate sector, is recruiting to fill the position below:

Job Position: Customer Representative Service Officer / Front Desk Officer

Job Location: Sangotedo, Ajah - Lagos
Employment Type: Full-time

The Role
     

        



     (adsbygoogle = window.adsbygoogle || []).push({});
    
    




	This is a pivotal dual-function role based at our Sangotedo, Ajah office.
	The successful candidate will serve as the company's first point of contact, managing all front-office operations, while also applying their practical knowledge in accounting for financial administration and assisting with basic legal documentation and filing related to property transactions.


Key Responsibilities
Front Desk & Client Relations:


	Manage the reception area, professionally greeting and directing clients and visitors.
	Handle all incoming calls, emails, and correspondence efficiently.
	Maintain an organized, professional, and presentable office environment.
	Schedule and manage appointments, meetings, and company calendars.


Accounting Support:


	Process invoices, receipts, and payments, ensuring accuracy and proper documentation.
	Assist in basic bookkeeping, data entry, and maintenance of financial records.
	Reconcile petty cash and simple bank accounts.
	Support the accounting department with documentation and filing.


Legal/Administrative Support (Real Estate Focus):


	Assist in the preparation, documentation, and filing of legal paperwork related to property sales and acquisitions (e.g., offer letters, client agreements, initial documentation review).
	Maintain organized physical and electronic files for client contracts and legal documents, ensuring confidentiality.
	Facilitate the submission of documents to the legal department or external counsel.


What We Are Looking For
Educational Qualifications:


	A minimum of B.Sc., HND, B.Hons., or equivalent qualification in Administration, Mass Communication, Secretarial/Clerical fields, or any other related field.


Experience:


	3 to 5 years of working experience in a Customer Care, Front Desk, or Client Relations role, preferably within the Real Estate, Legal, or Financial services industries.


Skills & Requirements:


	Proven, practical experience in basic Accounting or Bookkeeping is mandatory.
	Demonstrable experience or strong foundational knowledge in Legal Administration, Documentation, or Paralegal support, particularly concerning contracts or property agreements, is a significant advantage.
	Excellent verbal and written communication skills.
	Proficiency in Microsoft Office Suite (Word, Excel, Outlook).
	Exceptional organizational skills and high attention to detail, especially when handling confidential documents.
	Professional demeanor, integrity, and discretion.


Salary
N100,000 - N150,000 / month.

Method of Application 
Interested and qualified candidates should send their detailed resume and a cover letter clearly outlining their relevant experience in customer care, accounting, and legal/administrative support to: hpwanlighthouse@gmail.com using the Job Position as subject of the email.
